metadata.name: Suspicious PsExec Execution - Zeek
metadata.comment: detects execution of psexec or paexec with renamed service name, this rule helps to filter out the noise if psexec is used for legit purposes or if attacker uses a different psexec client other than sysinternal one

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM file_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (contains(lower(file.path), lower('\\')) AND contains(lower(file.path), lower('\\ipc$')) AND (endswith(lower(file.name), lower('-stdin')) OR endswith(lower(file.name), lower('-stdout')) OR endswith(lower(file.name), lower('-stderr'))) AND NOT startswith(lower(file.name), lower('psexesvc')))

output.summary: detects execution of psexec or paexec with renamed service name, this rule helps to filter out the noise if psexec is used for legit purposes or if attacker uses a different psexec client other than sysinternal one
